questions.question: Pick the evidence that BEST supports the theme statement: People are not purely good or purely evil.

choices.answer: "We acquired no traumas from watching our father win or lose."
"Mr. Cunningham's a good man, but he has his blind spots like all of us."
"He's the same in the courtroom as he is on the public streets."
"She is the victim of cruel poverty and ignorance, but I cannot pity her."

questions.question: Pick the theme statement that the evidence below BEST supports:

choices.answer: It's important to remain optimistic, despite the challenges you face.
Change doesn't happen all at once; it takes time to make a difference.
When you keep fighting no matter what, you'll always succeed in the end.
It's important to know when to accept defeat.

questions.question: Pick the evidence that BEST supports the theme statement: People should be respected & valued despite their differences.

choices.answer: "Cry about the simple hell people give other people—without even thinking."
"People have a way of carrying their resentments right into a jury box.”
"On must lie under certain circumstances and when nothing can be done."
“I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.”

questions.question: Pick the theme statement that the evidence below BEST supports:

choices.answer: Live your life humbly and others will treat you with kindness.
You don't need other people in your life to be happy.
Sometimes we have to lie to those we love in order to survive.
Being happy is more important than fitting into what other people think.

questions.question: Pick the evidence that BEST supports the theme statement: Living a life you're proud of may mean disappointing others.

choices.answer: "You're not gonna change any minds by talkin' right, they've gotta want to.
The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
"...Fine Folks did the best they could with the sense they had."
"...You must try to behave like the little lady and gentleman you are."

questions.question: Pick the theme statement that the evidence below BEST supports:

choices.answer: We should all work to protect the truly innocent from harm.
It's a sin to take away the life of another creature.
Careful and thoughtful parenting can overcome lots of life's hurt.
Growing into an adult requires a loss of childlike innocence.

questions.question: Pick the evidence that BEST supports the theme statement: Even people we know and trust can do horrible things.

choices.answer: "Mr. Cunningham was part of a mob last night, but he was still a man."
"Mockingbirds don’t do one thing but make music for us to enjoy."
"Let the dead bury the dead."
"They're willing to let him do what they're too afraid to do themselves..."

questions.question: Pick the theme statement that the evidence below BEST supports:

choices.answer: Sometimes bad things happen to good people.
We should show empathy to others who are different instead of judging them.
People are inherently good—or evil.
If you don't have something nice to say about someone, you shouldn't speak.

questions.question: Pick the theme statement that the evidence below BEST supports:

choices.answer: To have courage, you must be willing to die for what you believe in.
You can accomplish your dreams if you put in the hard work to reach them.
Real courage is when you persist through times of difficulty.
If you're afraid to try, you'll never win.

questions.question: Pick the evidence that BEST supports the theme statement: As we grow up, we lose our innate sense of right and wrong.

choices.answer: "Let him get a little older and he won't get sick and cry."
“You never really understand a person...until you climb into his skin..."
"After all, if Aunty could be a lady at a time like this, so could I."
"Tom was a dead man the minute Mayella opened her mouth and screamed."

questions.question: Pick the theme statement that the evidence below BEST supports:

choices.answer: If you live with sympathy, you can keep your faith in humanity alive.
Only those who live with kindness deserve fulfilling lives.
If you give someone a chance, they may surprise you.
You shouldn't let other people's opinions interfere with the way you live.

questions.question: Pick the theme statement that the evidence below BEST supports:

choices.answer: We shouldn't judge others by their appearances.
With love and kindness, any obstacle can be overcome.
When we live with empathy, we better understand those important to us.
Changing your perspective can give you a new outlook on life.
